intro: Fagara heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf sycamore, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Panama. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to elliptical, and its fragrant, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and can reach heights of up to 10 meters. The fruit is a woody capsule that contains several small, smooth seeds.
